info.title: How to Properly Clean a Beretta 40 Caliber Pistol
info.description: How to break down a Beretta 40 properly/safely and perform maintenance
warnings: Please read and understand your local and federal laws before handling any weapon
Treat every weapon as if it were loaded
Never point a weapon at anyone (including yourself)
Keep the safety on until you intend to shoot
Keep your finger straight and off the trigger until you intend to shoot

1.title: 1. Safety First
1.details: The first thing you need to do when handling any weapon is the clear the weapon

2.title: 2. Ejecting Magazine
2.details: If there is a magazine in the M9 pistol, hit the quick release button to eject the magazine

3.title: 3. Ejecting Rounds
3.details: Point the weapon in a safe direction (facing away from you or anyone else) and pull the slide back to eject any rounds that may be in the chamber of the pistol

4.title: 4. Verifying Emptiness
4.details: Lock the slide to the rear and visually inspect the chamber of the pistol to make sure no round is still in the chamber

5.title: 5. Starting Breakdown
5.details: Once the weapon is clear, you can start breaking down the weapon to clean it

6.title: 6. Unlocking
6.details: Hit the release lock button and send the slide forward

7.title: 7. Derailing Slide
7.details: Pull the lever down and rack the slide back (as you pull the slide back, it will come off the rails)

8.title: 8. Releasing Tension
8.details: While still holding the slide, take the spring off to release the tension

9.title: 9. Removing Rod
9.details: Take the rod out of the spring

10.title: 10. Removing Barrel
10.details: Slide the barrel from the top part of the slide

11.title: 11. Cleaning
11.details: Now you can clean the weapon

12.title: 12. Returning Rod
12.details: Once you are done cleaning, you can put the rod back into the spring

13.title: 13. Returning Barrel
13.details: Slide the barrel back in the top part of the slide

14.title: 14. Returning Spring
14.details: Put the spring/rod in the grove under that barrel

15.title: 15. Relocking
15.details: Slide the top slide on the rails of the grip. Once it is pushed forward, push up on the level to lock it in place.
